title: Duck stir-fry with baby corn, cashews and mangetout

default: 100g/3½oz baby sweetcorn, cut in half lengthways
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper

steps: Heat the oil in a wok until smoking. Add the mangetout, sweetcorn and cashew nuts and fry for 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but retaining a bit of bite.
Add the duck breast slices to the wok and stir fry for 1-2 minutes, then add the rest of the ingredients. Cook until the sauce is reduced and sticky, and the duck is cooked to your liking.
Pile the stir-fry onto a serving plate and serve.
